meanings.definition: To make or become fresh or fresher.
meanings.sent1: After a long nap, I freshened up and felt more awake.
meanings.sent2: I like to freshen my room by opening the windows and letting in the breeze.
meanings.sent3: The flowers in the garden freshened up after the rain, looking vibrant and colorful.
meanings.sent4: Her smile freshened up the room, bringing a sense of joy to everyone.
meanings.sent5: The cool shower freshened me up, washing away the tiredness of the day.

meanings.definition: To revive or renew in vigor or appearance.
meanings.sent1: A quick break can freshen your mind and help you focus better.
meanings.sent2: Using a bit of perfume can freshen up your outfit and make you feel more confident.
meanings.sent3: The joke he told freshened up the atmosphere, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: A new coat of paint can freshen up an old room, making it look brand new.
meanings.sent5: A walk in the park can freshen up your spirits and lift your mood.

meanings.definition: To add fresh ingredients to a dish or drink.
meanings.sent1: I like to freshen my salads with a squeeze of lemon juice.
meanings.sent2: Adding mint leaves can freshen up a glass of water and make it more refreshing.
meanings.sent3: She decided to freshen up the soup with some herbs from the garden.
meanings.sent4: The chef always knows how to freshen up a dish with a sprinkle of spices.
meanings.sent5: A slice of orange can freshen up a plain glass of water, adding a burst of flavor.
